title: Bojan set to leave Stoke as boss Mark Hughes plots major summer squad overhaul
text:
Mark his words Bojan set to leave Stoke as boss Mark Hughes plots major summer squad overhaul 
Potters boss wants to revitalise his squad having lost patience with a number of his current crop By Graham Hill Comments BOJAN is set to lead a Stoke City exodus this summer 
The Potters are ready to listen to offers for the ex-Barcelona wonderkid, 26, who is out on loan with German side Mainz after complaining about a lack of game time under Mark Hughes. PA:Press Association 3 Bojan could be one of the first names to leave the Potters this summer 
Stoke boss Hughes is likely to stage a major clearout before next season in a bid to revitalise his squad. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
Wilfried Bony looks certain to return to Manchester City after a miserable loan spell at Stoke. 
Midfielders Ibrahim Afellay and Stephen Ireland are out of contract and still with a point to prove after long-term injuries. 
Defenders Marc Muniesa and Philipp Wollscheid, along with striker Joselu – on loan at Deportivo la Coruna – are set to exit. But Bojan remains popular with Stoke fans who would be reluctant to see him leave. 
Hughes hinted that Bojan still has a future in the Potteries next summer – but he is more likely to bring in fresh faces.
